results.title: Symptomatic Hypoglycemia During Treatment with a Therapeutic Dose of Metformin
results.text_hl: Within 2 weeks of discontinuing @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@, there were no further "attacks", and the chronic @DISEASE_Fatigue @DISEASE_MESH:D005221 @@@daytime fatigue@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@somnolence@@@ significantly improved.

citations.NLM: Joseph CMC. Symptomatic Hypoglycemia During Treatment with a Therapeutic Dose of Metformin Am J Case Rep. 2021 Jun 2;22():e931311. PMID: 34075013
citations.BibTeX: @article{34075013, title={Symptomatic Hypoglycemia During Treatment with a Therapeutic Dose of Metformin}, author={Joseph CMC}, journal={Am J Case Rep}, volume={22}, pages={e931311}}

results.title: Bioequivalence and pharmacokinetic comparison of two fixed dose combination of Metformin/ Glibenclamide formulations in healthy subjects under fed condition.
results.text_hl: Bioequivalence and pharmacokinetic comparison of two fixed dose combination of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@/ @CHEMICAL_Glyburide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005905 @@@Glibenclamide@@@ formulations in healthy subjects under fed condition.

results.title: Using continuous glucose monitoring to assess contributions of premeal and postmeal glucose levels in diabetic patients treated with metformin alone.
results.text_hl: For HbA1c levels >=7.7%, add-on therapy to @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ should preferentially target control of @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@BEG@@@, whereas targeting both @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@BEG@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@PEG@@@ could be of equivalent importance with lower HbA1c levels.

citations.NLM: Lin SD, Su SL, Wang SY, Tu ST, Hsu SR. Using continuous glucose monitoring to assess contributions of premeal and postmeal glucose levels in diabetic patients treated with metformin alone. Diabetes Metab. 2016 Nov;42(5):336-341. PMID: 27068362

results.title: Metformin added to intensive insulin therapy improves metabolic control in patients with type 1 diabetes and excess body fat.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ added to intensive @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@ therapy improves metabolic control in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_1 @DISEASE_MESH:D003922 @@@type 1 diabetes@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@excess body@@@ fat.

results.title: Effect of metformin on sleep disorders in adolescent girls with polycystic ovarian syndrome.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ can reduce the incidence of @DISEASE_Sleep_Wake_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D012893 @@@sleep disorders@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@excessive daytime sleepiness@@@ in adolescent girls with @DISEASE_Polycystic_Ovary_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D011085 @@@PCOS@@@.

citations.NLM: El-Sharkawy AA, Abdelmotaleb GS, Aly MK, Kabel AM. Effect of metformin on sleep disorders in adolescent girls with polycystic ovarian syndrome. J Pediatr Adolesc Gynecol. 2014 Dec;27(6):347-52. PMID: 25256878

results.title: Clinical spectrum of premature pubarche: links to metabolic syndrome and ovarian hyperandrogenism.
results.text_hl: In these @SPECIES_9606 @@@girls@@@, @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy may reverse the progression to clinical @DISEASE_Ovarian_Diseases @DISEASE_MESH:D010049 @@@ovarian hyperandrogenism@@@, normalize body composition and @<m>DISEASE_Disorders_of_Excessive_Somnolence</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006970 @@@excess@@@ visceral fat, and delay pubertal progression without attenuating linear growth and bone mineralization, suggesting that adult height may be improved.

citations.NLM: Ibáñez L, Díaz R, López-Bermejo A, Marcos MV. Clinical spectrum of premature pubarche: links to metabolic syndrome and ovarian hyperandrogenism. Rev Endocr Metab Disord. 2009 Mar;10(1):63-76. PMID: 18726694
